Class ContinuousIntegrationServer

lab2.ContinuousIntegrationServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Container, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Destroyable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Dumpable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Dumpable.DumpableContainer, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle
public class ContinuousIntegrationServer extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
Skeleton of a ContinuousIntegrationServer which acts as webhook See the Jetty documentation for API documentation of those classes.

  • Method Details

    • payloadToString

      public String payloadToString(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Reads the HTTP request body and returns the payload as a String.

      For non-{POST} requests, this method logs a message and returns an empty string, since only POST requests are expected from the GitHub webhook.

      Parameters:
      request - the incoming servlet request
      Returns:
      the raw request body as a string, or an empty string on non-POST or read error

    • parseJSON

      public void parseJSON(String payloadString) throws Exception
      Parses a GitHub webhook JSON payload and extracts repository and commit information.

      On success, this method populates the instance fields {#owner}, {#repo}, {#sha}, {#cloneUrl} and {#branch}. If the payload is empty, an Exception is thrown to signal an invalid webhook call.

      Parameters:
      payloadString - the JSON payload received from GitHub
      Throws:
      Exception - if the payload is empty or cannot be processed according to the contract

    • handle

      public void handle(String target, org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request baseRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException, javax.servlet.ServletException
      Primary Jetty handler method invoked for every incoming HTTP request.

      Behaviour:

      • Serves build history list at /builds.
      • Serves individual build details at /builds/{id}.
      • For POST requests, treats the request as a GitHub webhook: parses the JSON payload, clones the repository, runs tests, sends a status back to GitHub, and records the build in history.
      • For other routes/methods, returns a simple informational message.
      Specified by:
      handle in interface org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler
      Specified by:
      handle in class org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
      Parameters:
      target - the target path of the HTTP request (e.g. /builds)
      baseRequest - the Jetty base request object
      request - the servlet request
      response - the servlet response used to send data back to the client
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while handling the request
      javax.servlet.ServletException - if the servlet container encounters an error

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
      Application entry point used to start the CI server from the command line.

      Creates and configures a Jetty Server instance on port 8080, registers this class as the request handler, and blocks while the server is running.

      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (currently ignored)
      Throws:
      Exception - if Jetty fails to start or encounters a fatal error
